New Records: Ryan Dunn led the Suns with 20 points, hitting 6-for-11 3-pointers.
Nikola Jokic finished with 21 points, 14 rebounds, and nine assists for the Nuggets.
Key Match Events: Denver led 33-26 after the first quarter.
Jokic had a vintage performance with 14 points, seven rebounds, and five assists in the first half.
The Suns trailed 51-60 at halftime but made a comeback in the third and fourth quarters.
Pre-Game Insights: Phoenix Suns traveled without Kevin Durant, Bradley Beal, and Devin Booker.
Phoenix Suns coach Mike Budenholzer opened the game without any starters.
Post-Match Reflections: The Nuggets are still looking for their first preseason win.
Russell Westbrook made his debut for the Nuggets, contributing nine points and six assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The frontcourt pairing of Bol Bol and Mason Plumlee struggled in the early game.
Denver's defense allowed Phoenix's bench players to make a significant impact.
Others: The game summary highlighted the performances of both teams' bench players.
